trans-unit.source: Serves as the base class for all data control field types, which represent a column of data in tabular data-bound controls such as <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> class serves as the base class for all data control field types.

Data control fields are used by data-bound controls to represent a field of data, similar to how a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> object represents a type of column in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.

Use the classes that are derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> to control how a field of data is displayed in a data-bound control such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>.
The following table lists the different data control field types provided by ASP.NET.
Column field type
Description
Displays the value of a field in a data source as text.
Displays a command button in a data-bound control.
Depending on the control, this allows you to display either a row or a column with a custom button control, such as an Add or a Remove button.
Displays a check box in a data-bound control.
This data control field type is commonly used to display fields with a Boolean value.
Displays built-in command buttons to perform edit, insert, or delete operations in a data-bound control.
Displays the value of a field in a data source as a hyperlink.
This data control field type allows you to bind a second field to the hyperlink's URL.
Displays an image in a data-bound control.
Displays user-defined content in a data-bound control according to a specified template.
You can also extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BoundField> classes to create your own data control field types.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> class provides many properties that determine how user interface (UI) elements are presented in the data-bound control.
Not every control uses every available data control field property when rendering a UI.
For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control, which displays the data control fields as rows, includes a header item for each data control field, but no footer item.

Therefore, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.FooterText%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.FooterStyle%2A> properties are ignored by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control, however, uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.FooterText%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.FooterStyle%2A> properties if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.ShowFooter%2A> property is set to `true`.
Similarly, the data control field properties affect the presentation of UI elements depending on what the element is.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.ItemStyle%2A> property is always applied to the field.

If the type derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> contains a control, as in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonField> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxField> classes, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.ControlStyle%2A> property is applied to the field.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> class.
Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> class is abstract, you cannot create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> object directly.
This constructor is commonly called by the constructor of a derived class to initialize the properties defined in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> class.
Gets or sets text that is rendered as the `AbbreviatedText` property value in some controls.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.OnFieldChanged%2A> method is called to raise a state change event when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.AccessibleHeaderText%2A> property is set.
The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.AccessibleHeaderText%2A> property is stored in view state.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
A string that represents abbreviated text read by screen readers.
The default value is an empty string ("").
Creates a duplicate copy of the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref>-derived object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.CloneField%2A> method is a helper method used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCollection.CloneFields%2A> method to create a copy of the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField>-derived object.
A duplicate copy of the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref>.
Gets a reference to the data control that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object is associated with.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.Control%2A> reference is set when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.Initialize%2A> method is called.
The data control that owns the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref>.
Gets the style of any Web server controls contained by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.ControlStyle%2A> property governs the appearance of any Web server controls contained by types derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField>.
This property does not affect all derived types.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BoundField> control, which typically displays text data and contains only <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TextBox> controls, is only affected by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.ControlStyle%2A> property when in <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState.Edit> state.

Web server controls such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonField> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxField> might be affected by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.ControlStyle%2A> property, depending on the specific configuration of the control object instances contained by the field.

For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonField> control can be rendered as a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageButton>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button> object.

Although a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> control is affected by `font` attributes of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object, a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button> control is not.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> that governs the appearance of Web server controls contained by the field.

Copies the properties of the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref>-derived object to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.CopyProperties%2A> method is a helper method used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.CloneField%2A> method to copy the properties of the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField>-derived object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> object created by the method.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> to which to copy the properties of the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref>.
When overridden in a derived class, creates an empty <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref>-derived object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.CreateField%2A> method is a helper method used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.CloneField%2A> method to create an empty <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField>-derived object to copy the properties of the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField>-derived object into.
An empty <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref>-derived object.
Gets a value indicating whether a data control field is currently viewed in a design-time environment.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.DesignMode%2A> property exposes the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.DesignMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Control> instance that is passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.Initialize%2A> method is used.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> is currently viewed in a design-time environment; otherwise, `false`.
Extracts the value of the data control field from the current table cell and adds the value to the specified <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> collection.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.ExtractValuesFromCell%2A> method is implemented by types derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> to associate the current field with a value, if applicable.
The field/value pair is stored in the `dictionary` collection that is passed to the method.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.ExtractValuesFromCell%2A> method is called by the `ExtractRowValues` method of data controls such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>.
Call this method when you are writing a custom data-bound control that uses <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCell> objects to assemble a set of cells and their associated values.
Implement this method when you are writing a class derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> that displays user data or data-bound data.
Not all derived types implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.ExtractValuesFromCell%2A> method, because not all fields display user data.
For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonField> control displays a button and has no user data.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCell"></xref> that contains the text or controls of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState"></xref> values.
`true` to indicate that the values of read-only fields are included in the dictionary collection; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the style of the footer of the data control field.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.FooterStyle%2A> property governs the appearance of any text displayed in the footer item of a type derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField>.
Some data-bound controls do not render a footer item for a data control field.
For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control displays its data control fields as rows.
A footer item is not rendered for these data control fields.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.FooterStyle%2A> property is ignored in these controls.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableItemStyle"></xref> that governs the appearance of the footer item of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref>.
Gets or sets the text that is displayed in the footer item of a data control field.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.FooterText%2A> property to add notes or comments to a data control field, or for other data related to the field.
Some data-bound controls do not render a footer item for a data control field.
For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control displays its data control fields as rows.
A footer item is not rendered for these data control fields.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.FooterStyle%2A> property is ignored in these controls.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
A string that is displayed in the footer item of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref>.
Gets or sets the URL of an image that is displayed in the header item of a data control field.
Set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.HeaderImageUrl%2A> property when you want an image displayed in the header item of a data control instead of header text.

If both the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.HeaderText%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.HeaderImageUrl%2A> properties are set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.HeaderImageUrl%2A> property has precedence.
A string that represents a fully qualified or relative URL to an image that is displayed in the header item of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref>.
Gets or sets the style of the header of the data control field.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.HeaderStyle%2A> property governs the appearance of any text displayed in the header item of a type derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField>.

The most common application of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.HeaderStyle%2A> property is to alter the style of the column headers in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableItemStyle"></xref> that governs the appearance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> header item.
Gets or sets the text that is displayed in the header item of a data control field.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.HeaderText%2A> property to identify a field in a data control with a friendly name.

The most common application of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.HeaderText%2A> property is to provide meaningful column names for data-bound fields in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.

If both the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.HeaderText%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.HeaderImageUrl%2A> properties are set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.HeaderImageUrl%2A> property has precedence.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
A string that is displayed in the header item of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref>.
Performs basic instance initialization for a data control field.

The control that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> object is associated with calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.Initialize%2A> method to initialize the field before it is added to a rows collection.

Data controls such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> call the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.Initialize%2A> method in their `CreateChildControls` methods before calling other methods such as `CreateRow` to create specific rows with data.

Call this method when you are writing a custom data-bound control that uses <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCell> objects to perform basic initialization for any <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> objects.

Implement this method if your derived type requires any object initialization before it populates <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCell> objects with data or controls in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.InitializeCell%2A> method.
A value that indicates whether the control supports the sorting of columns of data.
The data control that owns the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref>.
Always returns `false`.
Adds text or controls to a cell's controls collection.

Types derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.InitializeCell%2A> method to add text and controls to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCell> object that belongs to a data control that uses tables to display a user interface (UI).
These data controls create the complete table structure row by row when their respective `CreateChildControls` methods are called.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.InitializeCell%2A> method is called by the `InitializeRow` method of data controls such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>.

Call this method when you are writing a custom data-bound control that uses <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCell> objects to initialize the cells of the table structure with data or controls.
Implement this method when you are writing a class derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField>.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCell"></xref> that contains the text or controls of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlCellType"></xref> values.

One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState"></xref> values, specifying the state of the row that contains the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCell"></xref>.
The index of the row that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlFieldCell"></xref> is contained in.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object is visible when its parent data-bound control is in insert mode.
A data-bound control is in insert mode when the state of the current display row is <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control checks the value of this property before it renders a set of fields.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.InsertVisible%2A> property is `false`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Visible%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object is set to `false`.
The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.InsertVisible%2A> property is stored in view state.
`true` if the field is visible when its parent data-bound control is rendered in insert mode; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `true`.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object is saving changes to its view state.
`true` if the data source view is marked to save its state; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the style of any text-based content displayed by a data control field.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.ItemStyle%2A> property governs the appearance of any text data displayed by a type derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField>.

For example, when you bind a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BoundField> control to text data, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.ItemStyle%2A> property to alter the appearance of the text that is displayed.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableItemStyle"></xref> that governs the appearance of text displayed in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref>.
Restores the data source view's previously saved view state.
This method is used primarily by the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state.
For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/0218d965-5d30-445b-b6a6-8870e70e63ce).

This method restores view-state information for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> object from a previous page request that was saved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.SaveViewState%2A> method.
An object that represents the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> state to restore.
Raises the `FieldChanged` event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.OnFieldChanged%2A> method raises an event signaling that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> object's state has changed.

Changes to the following properties cause this event to be raised: <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.FooterText%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.HeaderImageUrl%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.HeaderText%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.ShowHeader%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.SortExpression%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.Visible%2A>.
Derived type properties also raise this event when state changes occur.
Web server controls such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> typically call the `DataBind` method in response to a field change event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.OnFieldChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
Saves the changes made to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> view state since the time the page was posted back to the server.
This method is used primarily by control developers.
View state is the accumulation of the values of a server control's properties.
These values are automatically placed in the server control's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A> property, which is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> class.
This property's value is then persisted to a string object after the save state stage of the server control life cycle.
When view state is saved, a string is returned to the client as a variable that is stored in an HTML `hidden` element.
When you author custom server controls, you can improve efficiency by overriding this method and modifying your server control's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A> property.
For more information, see [ASP.NET View State Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/19d2a6ed-9a77-4c7c-a7f5-74dd4b6c3818).
The object that contains the changes to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> view state.
If there is no view state associated with the object, this method returns `null`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the header item of a data control field is rendered.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.ShowHeader%2A> property to specify whether the header item is displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> object.
`true` if the header item of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> is rendered; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets or sets a sort expression that is used by a data source control to sort data.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.OnFieldChanged%2A> method is called to raise a state change event when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.SortExpression%2A> property is set.
The value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.SortExpression%2A> property is stored in view state.
A sort expression that is used by a data source control to sort data.
The default value is an empty string ("").
Returns a string that represents this <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object.
This method is implemented to return the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.HeaderText%2A> property, if the property is set.
Otherwise, this method simply returns a string that represents the type of the data control field (for example, "BoundField").
A string that represents this <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref>.

Causes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object to track changes to its view state so they can be stored in the control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.ViewState"></xref> property and persisted across requests for the same page.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the control validates client input.
`true` if the control validates client input; otherwise, `false`.
When overridden in a derived class, signals that the controls contained by a field support callbacks.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.ValidateSupportsCallback%2A> method is a helper method used to determine whether the controls contained in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> object support callbacks.
The base implementation of this method has been implemented to throw a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> exception to indicate that callbacks are not supported.
This method is used primarily by control developers.
The method is called on a default instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> class.

Gets a dictionary of state information that allows you to save and restore the view state of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object across multiple requests for the same page.
A data control field's view state is the accumulation of all its property values.
To preserve these values across HTTP requests, ASP.NET server controls use this property, which is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> class, to store the property values.
The values are then passed as a variable to an HTML hidden input element when subsequent requests are processed.
For more information about saving server control view state, see [ASP.NET View State Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/19d2a6ed-9a77-4c7c-a7f5-74dd4b6c3818).
View state is enabled for all server controls by default, but there are circumstances when you will want to disable it.
For more information, see [ASP.NET Performance Overview](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f882bf1b-a009-4312-ac06-74370ffabc0b).
For more information about dictionaries and how to use them, see [Collections and Data Structures](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/60cc581f-1db5-445b-ba04-a173396bf872).
An instance of <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> that contains the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> view-state information.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a data control field is rendered.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.Visible%2A> property to show or hide <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField> objects in a data-bound control.
If the the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.Visible%2A> property is `false`, the data values are not displayed and do not make a round-trip to the client.
If you want to round-trip the data for a field that is not visible, add the field name to the `DataKeyNames` property of the data-bound control.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> is rendered; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `true`.
Gets or sets the schema associated with this <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object.
The schema associated with this <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object is saving changes to its view state.
`true` to indicate that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> is saving changes to its view state; otherwise, `false`.
Restores the data control field's previously saved view state.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the saved view state values for the control.
Saves the changes made to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> view state since the time the page was posted back to the server.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the saved view state values for the control.

Causes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField"></xref> object to track changes to its view state so they can be stored in the control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlField.ViewState"></xref> property and persisted across requests for the same page.
